b shows the thermoluminescence curves of
the wavelength of the excitation light is shorter, the energy is
higher, and the rate of the energy storage is faster. However,
the thermoluminescence intensity of the sample excited by a
250 nm light source is the lowest. With the increase in the
excitation light wavelength, the intensity of thermolumines-
cence curve increases gradually. The thermoluminescence
curve is the strongest at the excitation of a 460 nm light source.
However, the main excitation peak of BASO:0.3Eu
excitation spectra is located at around 380 nm. According to
the analysis above, we can assume that the trap in the material
has its own energy level distribution, and the lowest trap level
must be lower than the bottom level of the d band of Eu
the material, so that the persistent luminescence property of
the sample is better when excited by the blue light with lower
In the process of the preparation of BASO:Eu
mixture of rare-earth ions and the change in the matrix both
result in the generation of the defects. Because the ionic radii
ions in the lattice mainly substitute the position of Ba
The ionic solid-phase reaction chemical formula of the Eu
ions doped into the matrix is as follows:
Ba Al Si O : Eu , Tm 0.5 V
doped into the lattice is a kind of equivalent substitution
lattice is a kind of non-equivalent substitution process. Point
is generated after the substitution of Ba
positive charge. To balance the charge of the crystal, one Ba
with two negative charges will be generated
ions enter the lattice. Reducing the synthetic
atmosphere makes some O ions react with the reducing gas
and break away. Thus, there exists O ion vacancy V
, mainly aﬀects the photoluminescence property and
persistent luminescence color of the material. V
negative charges, which can act as the vacancy trap in the
material. Owing to the positive charge of Tm
defects, they are able to serve as the electron capture trap.
We have already analyzed the existing defects
in detail. To understand the function of
diﬀerent kinds of defects to the persistent luminescence of
materials better, we prepared the other co-doped trivalent rare-
terized them with the thermoluminescence curve. In
at diﬀerent excitation light. (c) Thermoluminescence curves of BASO:0.3Eu
